summary: Integers are numbers that can be positive, negative, or zero. Adding and subtracting them is like walking along a number line: move right for positive numbers, move left for negative numbers. To subtract, add the opposite number.

concepts.title: Adding a Positive Integer
concepts.kid_friendly: Move to the right on the number line.

concepts.title: Adding a Negative Integer
concepts.kid_friendly: Move to the left on the number line.

concepts.title: Subtracting Integers
concepts.kid_friendly: Subtracting is the same as adding the opposite.

worked_examples.title: Example 1: Add -3 and 5
steps: Start at -3 on the number line.

worked_examples.title: Example 2: Subtract 8 - 10
steps: Start at 8 and move 10 steps left.

teaching_tips: Use a number line to make movements clear.
Play simple games where kids walk left and right to model adding and subtracting.

medium.explain: Both negative, add and keep the sign: -12.

challenge.explain: Subtract the smaller from the bigger and keep the larger's sign: -5.
